byline.original: By JOHN MURA and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

abstract: Fatal shooting of unarmed black motorist Samuel DuBose by white University of Cincinnati campus police officer Ray Tensing is causing Cincinnati officials to rethink police department policy that allowed a less racially diverse, and some say inadequately trained, force to patrol residential area that went well beyond boundaries of school's campus; university has suspended patrols and is initiating full review of its policing policies.
lead_paragraph: The shooting of Mr. DuBose, a black man, has prompted officials to reconsider a policy that allowed a university force to patrol an area far more complex than its campus.

headline.main: Samuel DuBose’s Death in Cincinnati Points to Off-Campus Power of College Police
headline.print_headline: Policing Plan in Cincinnati Goes Astray

snippet: The shooting of Mr. DuBose, a black man, has prompted officials to reconsider a policy that allowed a university force to patrol an area far more complex than its campus.
